titles.title: To amend the Truth in Lending Act to prohibit issuers of credit cards from limiting the ability of Federal, State, and local government agencies to impose fees for honoring credit cards, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

bill.summary: 3/8/1995--Introduced. Amends the Truth in Lending Act to: (1) prohibit a card issuer from limiting or prohibiting the ability of a Federal, State, or local governmental agency to impose upon a credit card user a fee for honoring such card; (2) limit the amount of any fee a governmental agency may impose for the use of a credit card to make a payment to such agency; and (3) specify the taxes, fines, penalties, and fees such an agency may impose.
